moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 c6 3. e3 Bf5 4. Nc3 Nf6 5: perhaps played with a view to ... Bh7 if Nh4 by white
moves.8. Ne5: playing for f4 a possible stonewall attack formation
moves.9. f4 Nxc3 10. bxc3 f6: this loses a pawn at best.  it was necessary to play 10 ... 0-0 first
moves.11. Bh5+ Ke7: this costs an exchange.  giving up a pawn with 11 ... g6 might be preferrable
moves.12. Nf7 Qf8: this loses a piece 12 ... Qg8 was indicated
moves.13. Nxd6 Qd8: 13 ... Qg8 was a little better though white should win with 14 Nxf5+ exf5 15 Ba3+ Kd7 16 cxd5 cxd5 17 Qa4+ Nc6 18 c4 a piece ahead and an attack coming.  Weaker would be 14 Nf7? g6! 15 Nxh8 gxh5 16 Qxh5 Qxh8 when white is only an exchange an a pawn ahead
moves.14. Nf7 Qc8 15. Ba3+: forcing black's king to the center
